Comment: Some of them have submission histories full of hawking resorts or car dealerships, but imagine the damage well-trained chatbot accounts could do over social media during an election.  We saw them try six or seven months ago, and the more we let them scrape and train unchallenged the worse it'll get. Once they rack up a couple of hundred karma over a few months, mods start to assume they're real users... plus they can start operating in age- or karma-gated subs.
Author: 4ivE

Comment: It's amazing how much more peaceful it became after the election here, isn't it?  They became fairly easy to spot towards the end. But you're right, they'll only get better.   The biggest thing folks here overlooked imo... is it wasn't just far right-wing/Russian disinformation; the bots were also pushing far left narratives and vitriol.  If a disinterested moderate roamed in here at that time, they'd see mostly hate.
Author: nerphurp
